title: RealFi CredID: Cardano-Powered RealFi for Students
summary: In LATAM, 70% of 210M students lack formal credit. Missing banking signals leads to exclusion and pushes them to high-cost lenders, limiting their progress, stability, and economic mobility.
solution: We will launch Cardano’s first institutional microlending platform using verifiable student credentials. Smart contracts will score with ZK proofs and offer fair, transparent microloans for students.
proposer_relevant_experience:
Esteban Musso — CEO

Esteban serves as CEO, guiding the strategic direction, business vision, and overall execution of the initiative. With strong experience in leadership and innovation, he manages key partnerships, oversees growth strategies, and ensures the project delivers meaningful social and economic impact.



Guillermo Villanueva — CTO

Guillermo is the Chief Technology Officer and leads the technical architecture of the project. With extensive experience in software development and infrastructure design, he ensures the platform is secure, scalable, and efficient. His technical leadership drives the integration of identity, payments, and financial services into a robust, reliable system.



Fabio Budris — CBO

Fabio is responsible for business development, identifying market opportunities and building strategic alliances with universities, institutions, and partners. He develops sustainable business models and drives adoption, ensuring the solution reaches the communities that need it most.



Celina Villanueva — Product Manager

Celina leads product strategy and execution, ensuring the platform is user-centered, intuitive, and aligned with the project’s goals of identity-driven inclusion and financial access. She oversees product development end-to-end, combining strategic vision with a deep understanding of student and institutional needs.



Anibal Jalaris — Technical Legal Consultant

Anibal provides legal and regulatory guidance, ensuring compliance with data protection, digital identity, financial regulations, and institutional requirements. As both a lawyer and an IT leader, he brings a dual perspective that combines technical depth with legal rigor. His expertise strengthens trust, mitigates regulatory risks, and supports the legal structure essential for deploying payments and microcredit solutions.



Ailen Díaz — Technical Leader

Ailen is the Technical Leader overseeing backend development, security standards, and system integration. She coordinates the technical team and ensures every component—identity workflows, payments, data handling, and user authentication—meets high standards of reliability and performance.

sub_fields.title: Category Questions
sub_fields.description: Answer the following questions to determine the eligibility of your proposal.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Competitive Landscape Analysis:



Traditional banking excludes students entirely—they require employment history, collateral, or existing credit scores that students lack. Result: 70% of Latin American students have zero access to formal credit.



Fintech microlenders (Kueski, Monedo in Mexico) fill the gap but charge 48-120% APR. Their black-box credit algorithms perpetuate information asymmetry rather than solving it. Students can't understand why they're denied or how to improve their standing.



DeFi lending (Aave, Compound) requires crypto collateral exceeding 100% of loan value. Students without existing crypto wealth are excluded by design. Anonymous protocols can't verify student status or enrollment—identity is absent by design.



Other blockchain identity projects focus on SSI infrastructure without unlocking economic value. They prove credentials work technically but don't demonstrate what verified identity enables for real people.



Our Innovation:



We combine five elements no competitor has integrated:



1. Proven institutional deployment: 640,000 users across government (Buenos Aires) and university (UAGro) environments, not theoretical prototypes. We've operationalized SSI at scale.



2. Zero-knowledge credit scoring: Credit scores live in student wallets as verifiable credentials, not on-chain. Blockchain contains only zero-knowledge proofs. This ensures privacy while enabling portability—students carry their credit history across institutions without exposing personal data.



3. Dual-DID strategy: Our existing 640K QuarkID users provide the foundation. We're already working on implementing a migration path where each QuarkID identity receives a dual QuarkID/Identus DID. UAGro students (20K active, 100K target) become the first cohort generating critical mass for Identus adoption on Cardano. This bridges our proven infrastructure with Cardano's SSI ecosystem.



4. Regulatory compliance via SOCAPs: We partner with Sociedades Cooperativas de Ahorro y Préstamo (SOCAPs)—regulated Mexican savings and loan cooperatives. This provides legal framework for credit operations while maintaining our technology's permissionless nature. Universities avoid direct financial service regulation; SOCAPs handle compliance.



5. Transparent, improvable scoring: Students see exactly which factors affect their credit score (enrollment continuity, academic performance, scholarship status) and can improve their standing by presenting stronger credentials. This contrasts with fintech black boxes and traditional credit bureaus.



No other project combines institutional-scale SSI deployment, privacy-preserving on-chain credit verification, proven user base, regulatory compliance framework, and RealFI focus. We're not proposing RealFI; we're executing it.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
MVP Scope and Demonstration:



Our MVP will demonstrate complete end-to-end microlending on Cardano mainnet:



Credit Application Flow: Students with UAGro enrollment credentials stored in Micelya wallets will apply for loans directly in-app. The system will verify credentials via Verona Trust (multi-stack DID resolution), calculate credit scores using Plutus smart contracts, and present loan terms (amount, APR 10-18%, repayment schedule) with transparent factor breakdown showing how enrollment status, academic performance, and scholarship standing influence scoring.



Zero-Knowledge Proofs: Credit scores will be stored as verifiable credentials in student wallets. On-chain verification will use zero-knowledge proofs—blockchain validators can confirm score validity without accessing underlying personal data. This demonstrates privacy-preserving RealFI at scale.



Loan Execution: Upon student acceptance, smart contracts will automatically disburse funds to Micelya wallets. Repayment schedules will be tracked on-chain with each payment updating the student's credit history credential in their wallet.



Dual-DID Migration: The MVP will demonstrate our QuarkID → Identus migration strategy. UAGro students (starting with 50-100 pilot cohort) will receive dual DIDs, proving the technical pathway for bringing our 640K existing QuarkID users into Cardano's Identus ecosystem.



Access: Post-launch (Month 7), we'll provide the Catalyst community with:



Public Cardano explorer links (mainnet transaction monitoring)

Monthly progress dashboards (anonymized loan metrics)

Student testimonial videos (impact stories)

Open-source repository access (credit algorithm, smart contracts)



Technical reviewers can examine our current QuarkID infrastructure at [https://github\.com/ssi\-quarkid](https://github.com/ssi-quarkid) today.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
On-Chain Metrics (Transparent, Verifiable):

Credit score verifications: 2,000+ zero-knowledge proof validations on Cardano mainnet over 10 months. Each verification proves a student's credit score without revealing personal data—publicly auditable via blockchain explorers while maintaining privacy.

Loan originations: 500+ smart contract executions (one per loan disbursement). Transaction hashes provide immutable proof of volume and enable community monitoring of program growth.

Repayment transactions: 1,500+ on-chain payments (assuming 3 repayments per loan average). Success rate >85% target validates that verifiable credential-based credit scoring accurately assesses student creditworthiness.

Total on-chain activity: 5,000+ Cardano transactions (applications, disbursements, repayments, credential updates). Demonstrates sustained RealFI economic activity, not one-time pilots.

In-App Metrics (User Impact):

Pilot validation: 50-100 students in beta cohort (Month 7-8) test complete flow, provide UX feedback, demonstrate technical feasibility before full launch.

Scale achievement: 500+ total students served by Month 10, each gaining first formal credit access at 10-18% APR vs 48%+ fintech alternatives. Quantifiable economic benefit: $90-144 interest savings per $300 loan.

Portfolio performance: Repayment rate >85%, default rate <10% (vs 15-20% traditional microlending baseline). Proves institutional environment + verifiable credentials reduce risk.

Dual-DID adoption: 100% of participating UAGro students receive QuarkID + Identus dual identities, demonstrating migration pathway for our 640K existing user base to Cardano's SSI ecosystem.

Expansion Potential (Beyond Pilot):

University target: 60,000 students economically active within 18 months post-MVP.

Mexico pipeline: 500,000 students  within 18 months.

Latin America vision: 1M+ students accessible as we replicate validated model across regional universities.

The 500-student pilot proves the model; the real success metric is demonstrating clear pathway to 100X scale.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
The RealFI Bridge We're Building:



Cardano's RealFI vision addresses a fundamental global imbalance: regions with excess liquidity (Japan, Scandinavia, Gulf states with near-zero interest rates) need productive yield opportunities, while Latin America and Africa have massive productive potential but chronic credit scarcity. The bridge connecting these requires three elements: (1) blockchain infrastructure enabling capital flow across borders, (2) verifiable credentials reducing information asymmetry and risk premiums, (3) institutional trust anchors validating borrower legitimacy. We're operationalizing all three simultaneously.



Problem Depth:



Latin America's 210 million university students face systematic credit exclusion. Traditional banks require employment history (students don't have), collateral (students lack assets), or existing credit scores (students have none). This isn't risk-based exclusion—enrolled students with scholarship support are statistically reliable borrowers. It's information asymmetry: banks can't assess creditworthiness with available data, so they reject everyone or charge 48%+ APR to cover uncertainty.



Predatory fintech lenders exploit this gap. Companies like Kueski and Monedo in Mexico charge 60-120% APR with opaque algorithms. Students accept these terms because no alternatives exist. The debt trap is predictable: a $300 textbook loan becomes $480+ in repayment, forcing students to borrow again to cover basic expenses.



At UAGro specifically, 100,000 students generate approximately $24 million in annual credit demand (conservative estimate: $20/month per student for textbooks, technology, food, transport). Currently, 65% lack bank accounts. Those with access pay premium rates. The economic cost of exclusion compounds: students delay graduation, drop out during financial crises, or forgo educational opportunities due to capital constraints.



Our Approach:



We replace traditional credit signals (employment, assets, credit bureau history) with verifiable university credentials. Here's the operational flow:



Phase 1 - Identity Foundation (Already Operational):



UAGro issues student credentials via our existing QuarkID infrastructure—enrollment status, academic standing, scholarship awards, campus activity. These credentials live in students' Micelya wallets (20,000 students currently active). We're implementing a dual-DID strategy: each QuarkID identity receives a corresponding Identus DID. This creates a migration pathway bringing our 640K existing users into Cardano's SSI ecosystem, with UAGro students (20K active, 100K target) generating the first critical mass for Identus adoption.



Credentials are cryptographically signed, tamper-proof, and student-controlled via selective disclosure (students choose what to share). This foundation is operational today—not theoretical.



Phase 2 - Credit Scoring with Zero-Knowledge Proofs (Catalyst-Funded Development):



When students apply for loans, Plutus smart contracts analyze presented credentials:



Enrollment status (continuous enrollment = lower risk)

Academic performance (GPA, completion rate—student chooses to share)

Scholarship status (verified income proxy)

Payment history (if previous Micelya loans exist)

Campus activity (library usage, attendance—optional, privacy-preserving)



Critical Innovation: Credit scores are stored as verifiable credentials in student wallets, not on-chain. Blockchain contains only zero-knowledge proofs validating score authenticity without exposing personal data. This ensures:



Privacy: Personal attributes never touch the blockchain

Portability: Students carry scores across institutions via wallet

Verifiability: Anyone can confirm score validity via ZK-proof

Student control: Scores live in user-controlled wallets, not institutional databases



Algorithm outputs: Credit score (0-1000), recommended loan amount ($100-600 range), interest rate (10-18% APR based on risk assessment), repayment schedule (typically 3-6 months).



Transparency is critical: students see exactly which factors affect their score and how to improve it (maintain enrollment, share stronger academic credentials, build repayment history). This differs fundamentally from fintech black boxes.



Phase 3 - Regulatory Compliance via SOCAPs:



We partner with Sociedades Cooperativas de Ahorro y Préstamo (SOCAPs)—regulated Mexican savings and loan cooperatives that provide inclusive financial services to their members. These partnerships allow Micelya to offer compliant credit products within our campus ecosystem while:



Universities avoid direct financial service regulation (SOCAPs handle compliance)

Students access regulated financial products (not unregulated fintech)

Capital providers have legal framework for institutional lending

Technology remains permissionless (SOCAPs use our infrastructure, don't control it)



This regulatory strategy is critical for institutional adoption and scalability across Latin America's diverse regulatory environments.



Phase 4 - Loan Execution:



Student accepts terms → Smart contract executes → Funds disburse to Micelya wallet (ADA or stablecoin). Repayment occurs via automatic deductions (if student opts in) or manual payments. Each repayment updates the credit score credential in student's wallet, improving future loan terms. Credit history is portable—if student transfers to UDG or UNAM, their wallet-based credit record follows them (unlike traditional credit bureaus limited to single countries or institutions).



Phase 5 - Capital Efficiency:



Initial seed capital ($30,000 from Catalyst budget) funds approximately 100 loans at $300 average. As students repay, capital revolves—each dollar funds 3-4 loans over 10 months. Pilot target: 500 students served with $150,000 total loan volume from $30K seed capital plus repayments.



Scale Potential Beyond Pilot:



This 500-student pilot validates the model for massive expansion:



UAGro: 100K students, 60K economically active target within 18 months post-MVP

UDG: 300K students (partnership discussions active)

Mexico national: 500K students across UNAM, TecNM, regional universities within 18 months

Latin America: 1M+ students accessible as we replicate across region



Why Cardano Specifically:



Identus adoption strategy: Our dual-DID approach brings 640K existing QuarkID users into Cardano's SSI ecosystem. UAGro students become the first cohort generating Identus critical mass, demonstrating migration pathway for our entire user base.



Plutus smart contracts: Enable complex credit scoring logic with deterministic execution. Transparent, auditable algorithms build trust with students and universities. Lower fees than Ethereum make microlending economics viable.



Zero-knowledge proofs: Cardano's roadmap for ZK-proof integration aligns perfectly with our privacy-preserving credit scoring architecture. We're building for Cardano's technical evolution.



Differentiation from DeFi:



Traditional DeFi (Aave, Compound) requires crypto collateral exceeding 100% of loan value—students don't have this. Anonymous protocols can't verify student status. Variable APRs create budget uncertainty. Our model uses verified identity as collateral substitute, institutional trust for risk reduction, and fixed rates for student planning. This is RealFI, not DeFi speculation.



The Last-Mile Contribution:



Most blockchain projects build infrastructure without demonstrating real-world value. Most microlending operates on traditional rails with traditional exclusions. We're the intersection: blockchain-native credit scoring + institutional partnerships + proven 640K-user deployment history + 20K operational baseline at UAGro. We don't theorize about RealFI; we execute it with measurable student impact.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
Quantifiable Student Impact:



Pilot Validation (10 months): 500 students gain first formal credit access, proving the model works technically and economically. Each student receives average $300 loans at 10-18% APR instead of 48%+ fintech alternative. Economic benefit per student: $90-144 in interest savings on a $300 loan. Multiply across 500 students: $45,000-72,000 in aggregate interest cost avoided during pilot alone.



Scale Potential (Post-Pilot):



The real impact lies in demonstrated scalability:



UAGro expansion: From 500 pilot students to 60,000 economically active within 18 months post-MVP. Total addressable credit demand: $14.4M annually at UAGro alone.

Mexico national network: 500,000 students across UDG (300K), UNAM (350K), TecNM (600K) within 18 months. Total addressable: $120M annual credit demand across Mexican university system.

Latin America vision: 1M+ students accessible as validated model replicates across regional universities. We're not stopping at 500—we're proving the pathway to 1M+.



Dropout Prevention: Emergency credit access prevents financial crises that force student departures. Conservative estimate: 10% of pilot borrowers (50 students) would have dropped out without emergency loan access. UAGro graduation value: graduates earn $12,000+ more annually than non-graduates in Guerrero state (Mexican government data). 50 students retained = $600K in future annual earnings enabled.



Portable Credit History Innovation: Credit scores live in student wallets as verifiable credentials, not institutional databases. Zero-knowledge proofs on Cardano validate score authenticity without exposing personal data. Result: Students transferring from UAGro to UDG or UNAM bring their credit history via wallet—no need to rebuild creditworthiness from zero at each institution. This creates network effects: each university joining expands the utility of existing students' credit profiles across the entire ecosystem.



Cardano Ecosystem Impact:



RealFI Narrative Validation: Cardano's differentiation vs Ethereum depends on institutional RealFI adoption, not DeFi speculation. We provide concrete evidence: Initially 500 students, scaling to 60K at UAGro, then 500K across Mexico, ultimately 1M+ across Latin America—all using Cardano for real economic activity (credit access), not crypto trading. This narrative strengthens Cardano's positioning with institutional investors, governments, and universities globally.



Identus Critical Mass Generation: Our dual-DID strategy brings 640K existing QuarkID users into Cardano's SSI ecosystem. UAGro students (20K active, 100K target) become the first major cohort generating Identus adoption. Every student receiving credit creates an Identus DID, demonstrating Cardano's SSI capabilities at institutional scale. This addresses Identus's cold-start problem—we're bringing existing users, not hoping for organic adoption.



Hydra Synergy: Our payments proposal (Proposal B) creates transaction history that strengthens credit scoring. Students with 6 months of campus payment data (Hydra L2) demonstrate financial behavior patterns that improve credit risk assessment. Combined impact: 30,000 economically active students (Proposal B) become eligible for microlending (Proposal A) based on verifiable payment history. The proposals are mutually reinforcing.



Developer Resources: Open-source credit algorithm, Verona Trust multi-stack DID resolver, and student credential schemas become reusable components. Other universities (Cardano or multi-chain) can fork our code, accelerating RealFI adoption beyond our direct deployments. Developer community gains institutional-grade reference implementations.



Global Replication Pathway:



Our phased expansion demonstrates clear scalability:



Phase 1 (Catalyst-funded, 10 months): UAGro pilot—500 students, $150K volume, <10% default rate, open-source deliverables published.



Phase 2 (Months 11-18): UAGro full deployment—60,000 students economically active, $14.4M annual credit volume, proven model at institutional scale.



Phase 3 (Months 12-18, parallel): Mexico expansion—UDG (300K students), UNAM discussions, TecNM partnerships. Total target: 500,000 students, $120M annual credit demand.



Phase 4 (Year 2-3): Latin American replication—28M university students across region. Institutional capital participation (impact funds, DeFi liquidity providers) at scale, connecting global excess liquidity with regional productive credit needs.



Broader RealFI Implications:



If verifiable credentials enable fair credit access for students, the same model applies to:



Gig workers (Uber/Rappi drivers with verifiable income credentials)

Micro-entrepreneurs (marketplace sellers with verifiable sales history)

Refugees (portable identity enables credit access in new countries)



We're not just solving student credit exclusion; we're proving the RealFI model works for any population with institutional verification but lacking traditional credit signals. Cardano becomes the infrastructure for global financial inclusion—starting with 500 students, scaling to millions.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Proven Track Record at Institutional Scale:



Buenos Aires Deployment (2022-Present): 620,000 citizens use QuarkID wallets (which we co-created) for government-issued digital credentials (ID cards, birth certificates, driver's licenses, social program verification). Sustained operation for 3+ years with 99.7% uptime. Zero major security incidents. Government partnership validates our ability to work with public institutions at population scale under regulatory scrutiny. This proves we can: (a) Deploy SSI at massive scale, (b) Maintain production systems reliably, (c) Navigate government compliance requirements, (d) Sustain operations beyond pilots.



UAGro Deployment (2024-Present): 20,000 active students using Micelya wallets daily for campus activities (credentials, access, library services, benefits). Operational metrics: 8.5M+ credentials issued, 99.7% wallet uptime over 2-year operational period across all deployments. ANUIES-TIC 2025 Award (Mexico's national ICT innovation award for universities) provides independent third-party validation—not self-reported metrics, but competitive national recognition. This proves we can: (a) Deploy at university scale, (b) Achieve daily active usage (not download-and-abandon), (c) Gain institutional endorsement, (d) Win competitive recognition validating deployment excellence.



Combined Evidence: We've operationalized SSI for 640,000 total users across government and university environments. This is not theoretical—we've solved real-world deployment challenges (institutional IT integration, regulatory compliance, user adoption, sustained operations) that most blockchain projects only theorize about.



Technical Expertise Demonstrated:



Blockchain Development: 12 engineers with Cardano expertise (Plutus smart contracts, Identus protocol integration, Hydra L2 capabilities). Team members contributed to W3C DID/VC standards, participated in Trust Over IP Foundation working groups, and deployed production systems across multiple blockchains (Cardano, Ethereum, IOTA, Rootstock).



SSI Protocol Co-Creation: We are co-creators of QuarkID protocol ([https://github\.com/ssi\-quarkid\),](https://github.com/ssi-quarkid),) designated as UN Digital Public Good (2023). This recognizes our technical contribution to global SSI standards and open-source community. Multi-DID method support (did:quark, did:ethr, did:prism, did:key) demonstrates cross-chain interoperability expertise that will enable our dual-DID strategy (QuarkID + Identus).



Institutional Integration Experience: Successfully deployed at:



Government scale (Buenos Aires 620K users)

University scale (UAGro 100K students, 20K active)

International organizations (IDB supply chain project, INCUCAI healthcare credentials)

Multinational contracts (Gibraltar government digital ID system design)



Each deployment taught us critical lessons about institutional requirements: compliance (GDPR, Mexican data protection laws), reliability (99.7% uptime standard), user experience (students don't need to understand blockchain), and sustainability (beyond pilots to production systems).



[https://docs\.google\.com/document/d/1Bm70Ec7z\-knoKsoZrJbA7FVA\-Bgi2S9RgRL35nyAwOU/edit?tab=t\.0](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Bm70Ec7z-knoKsoZrJbA7FVA-Bgi2S9RgRL35nyAwOU/edit?tab=t.0)

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title

sub_fields.answer: Milestone 1 (Months 1–2) – Credit Algorithm + Audit

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
- Credit scoring contract (0–1000) using 5 factors: enrollment (300), grades (200), scholarships (150), repayment history (200), campus activity (150).
- Zero-knowledge proofs: scores stored in wallets; chain stores only ZK-proofs.
- Loan origination contract (disbursement + repayment tracking).
- Dual-DID support: QuarkID + Identus.
- Independent Cardano smart contract security audit.
- Testnet deployment + full technical documentatio

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
- Testnet contract live with source code.
- ZK-proofs generated in test wallets and verified on-chain.
- Sample QuarkID + Identus credentials processed with deterministic scores.
- Loan flow fully executed on testnet.
- Security audit completed with no critical issues.
- Documentation (algorithm, ZK-proofs, APIs) published.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
- GitHub repository: Plutus smart contract source code, ZK-proof schemas (public, Apache 2.0 license)
- Testnet transaction hashes: Credit score ZK-proof verifications, loan disbursements (Cardano explorer links)
- Security audit report: PDF from third-party auditor with findings and resolutions documented
- Technical documentation: Published to project website and GitHub wiki with ZK-proof specifications
- Video demonstration: Screencast showing dual-DID credential presentation → ZK-proof → scoring → loan execution on testnet

- UAGro staff training (10 people).

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion

sub_fields.answer:
- All DID types resolve correctly on testnet.
- 100% accuracy validating test UAGro credentials.
- Dual-DID creation successful for test students.
- Selective disclosure functional.
- Registrar API working in test environment.
- Wallet shows scores with factor breakdown.
- UAGro approves student onboarding materials.
- Staff training completed.

sub_fields.title: Who is participating in the project team and what are their roles?
sub_fields.description: Who is participating in the project team and what are their roles?
sub_fields.answer:
Esteban Musso — CEO

Esteban serves as CEO, guiding the strategic direction, business vision, and overall execution of the initiative. With strong experience in leadership and innovation, he manages key partnerships, oversees growth strategies, and ensures the project delivers meaningful social and economic impact.



Guillermo Villanueva — CTO

Guillermo is the Chief Technology Officer and leads the technical architecture of the project. With extensive experience in software development and infrastructure design, he ensures the platform is secure, scalable, and efficient. His technical leadership drives the integration of identity, payments, and financial services into a robust, reliable system.



Fabio Budris — CBO

Fabio is responsible for business development, identifying market opportunities and building strategic alliances with universities, institutions, and partners. He develops sustainable business models and drives adoption, ensuring the solution reaches the communities that need it most.



Celina Villanueva — Product Manager

Celina leads product strategy and execution, ensuring the platform is user-centered, intuitive, and aligned with the project’s goals of identity-driven inclusion and financial access. She oversees product development end-to-end, combining strategic vision with a deep understanding of student and institutional needs.



Anibal Jalaris — Technical Legal Consultant

Anibal provides legal and regulatory guidance, ensuring compliance with data protection, digital identity, financial regulations, and institutional requirements. As both a lawyer and an IT leader, he brings a dual perspective that combines technical depth with legal rigor. His expertise strengthens trust, mitigates regulatory risks, and supports the legal structure essential for deploying payments and microcredit solutions.



Ailen Díaz — Technical Leader

Ailen is the Technical Leader overseeing backend development, security standards, and system integration. She coordinates the technical team and ensures every component—identity workflows, payments, data handling, and user authentication—meets high standards of reliability and performance.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
Milestone 1 (Months 1–2): $45,000 – Credit scoring contract, ZK-proofs, dual-DID support, loan origination, security audit, testnet deployment.

Milestone 2 (Months 3–4): $40,000 – Verona Trust multi-stack integration, credential validation, UAGro schemas + registrar automation, wallet updates, onboarding + staff training.

Milestone 3 (Months 5–6): $42,000 – Mainnet deployment, dual-DID acceptance, ZK-verification, legal + regulatory review, compliance dashboard.

Milestone 4 (Months 7–8): $48,000 – Pilot launch (50–100 students), dual-DID issuance, ZK-scoring, 10+ on-chain loans, repayment tracking, UX research.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
Immediate Impact: 500+ students gaining formal credit access (first-ever for most), $150,000+ loan volume generating 5,000+ on-chain transactions, 2,000+ zero-knowledge proof validations demonstrating privacy-preserving RealFI.



Identus Ecosystem Growth: 100% of participating students (500+) receive dual-DIDs (QuarkID + Identus), proving migration pathway for our 640K existing QuarkID user base into Cardano's Identus ecosystem. This addresses Identus's cold-start problem—we're bringing existing users, not hoping for organic adoption.



Reusable Infrastructure: Open-source credit algorithm with ZK-proofs, Verona Trust multi-stack resolver with dual-DID support, loan contracts, credential schemas—all become public goods. Other universities can fork our code, reducing their development costs and accelerating Cardano RealFI adoption beyond our direct deployments.



Narrative Validation: First institutional proof of RealFI at scale (vs Ethereum DeFi speculation). 500-student pilot proves model for expansion to UAGro's 60,000 students, then Mexico's 500,000-student pipeline, ultimately Latin America's 1M+ addressable market.
